intro: Sida atlantidis, commonly known as the Atlantic sida, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Sida atlantidis is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or disturbed soils.
